newsitem.title: USA: Zilog sees Q3 EPS substantially below Q2.
newsitem.headline: Zilog sees Q3 EPS substantially below Q2.

text.p: Zilog Wednesday said it expects third-quarter earnings to be substantially below the second-quarter level of $0.60 a share.
In a statement, the maker of integrated computer circuits said it expects revenues for the third quarter ending September 29 to be between $64 million and $70 million.
In the second quarter, Zilog reported a profit of $12.4 million or $0.60 a share on revenues of $85.5 million.
According to First Call, analysts had expected the company to report a third quarter profit of $0.45 a share, down from $0.50 a share a year ago.

The company did not provide a reason for the shortfall but it said some of the factors that could cause actual results to differ are changes in order levels for the last month of the quarter or modifications to expected in product mix in the last month of the quarter.
